title: agent-skills: greenfield (development-plan.md)
description: Responsible vibe engineering session using greenfield workflow for agent-skills

title: Ideation
description: You are in the ideation phase for greenfield project. Understand WHAT the system should do, WHO will use it, WHY it's needed, and WHAT'S in/out of scope, e. g. • Are there existing solutions? What gaps do they have? • What technologies must/cannot be used? Why? • How will you measure product success? • Have you validated this need with potential users?  Don't discuss technical implementation yet - focus purely on understanding the problem space and requirements. Document all findings in  and create tasks as needed.

title: Define project vision and core value proposition
Identify target users and use cases
Explore the Agent Skills open standard in detail
Define scope: what is in and out of scope
Research existing MCP servers for patterns
Architecture
description: You are in the architecture phase. Based on the requirements from , now design the technical solution. Ask about the user's technical preferences and experience. Challenge their choices by presenting alternatives. Evaluate pros and cons of different tech stacks, frameworks, and architectural patterns. Consider non-functional requirements like scalability, performance, maintainability, and deployment. Create a comprehensive architecture document in . Don't start coding yet - focus on technical design decisions.

title: Design monorepo structure (CLI + MCP server packages)
Design security model for dynamic command execution
Plan
description: You are in the planning phase. Based on your completed architecture in  and requirements from , create a detailed implementation strategy. Break down the work into specific, actionable tasks considering the chosen tech stack and architectural decisions. Plan the implementation order, identify dependencies, and consider potential risks. Document the detailed design in  and create tasks thoroughly with clear milestones for implementation work.

title: Setup monorepo structure (pnpm workspace + packages)
description: Initialize pnpm workspace with 3 packages: core, cli, mcp-server. Add package.json, tsconfig.json, turbo.json

title: Write detailed design document
description: Document design principles, patterns, error handling, testing strategy in design.md

title: Implement @agentskills/core - SkillValidator
description: Validate Agent Skills format: required fields (name, description), optional fields, Claude Code extensions

title: Implement @agentskills/core - StringInterpolator
description: Replace placeholders: $ARGUMENTS, $N, ${CLAUDE_SESSION_ID}. Handle edge cases (missing args, escaping)

title: Implement @agentskills/core - SkillDiscovery
description: Find skills in file system (.claude/skills/, ~/.claude/skills/, custom dirs). Handle nested directories, watch for changes with chokidar

title: Research Claude Code skills management and CLI patterns
description: Investigate how Anthropic Claude Code manages skills: discovery, CLI commands, configuration. Research skills-ref CLI tool from agentskills.io

title: Design config file format for skill sources
description: Define .agentskills.json schema: list skills with sources (local/git/npm), similar to agentic-knowledge .knowledge/config.yaml pattern. Support init/download workflow

title: Define integration testing strategy
description: Review agentic-knowledge test samples. Define approach for testing MCP tools/resources, skill parsing, and CLI commands

title: Design core SkillRegistry API
description: Define registry interface: loadSkills(), getSkill(), getAllSkills(). Design in-memory storage structure. No file watching for MVP - load on startup only

title: Code
description: Follow your plan and detailed design from  to build the solution using the architecture from . Ensure all requirements from  you are currently working on are met. Write clean, well-structured code with proper error handling. Prevent regression by building, linting, and executing existing tests. Stay flexible and adapt the plan as you learn more during implementation, but maintain alignment with your architecture decisions. Update task progress and create new tasks as needed for current phase work.

title: Setup monorepo structure with pnpm + Turbo
description:
Initialize monorepo from template:
1. Deep copy ~/projects/templates/typescript-monorepo INCLUDING hidden files (.husky/, .github/, .git/hooks, .prettierrc.yaml, .lintstagedrc.js, .gitignore, etc)
2. Remove template example packages (typescript-example-1, typescript-example-2)
3. Create 3 new packages following template package structure:
   - packages/core/ (@agentskills/core)
   - packages/cli/ (@agentskills/cli) 
   - packages/mcp-server/ (@agentskills/mcp-server)
4. Update root package.json: name="agentskills-mcp", description, repository
5. Keep pnpm-workspace.yaml (packages: "packages/*")
6. Keep turbo.json, tsconfig.*.json configs
7. Run pnpm install to install dependencies and setup husky hooks
8. Verify pre-commit hooks work (lint-staged, tests)
9. Each package gets: package.json, src/, tsconfig.json, vitest.config.ts, eslint.config.mjs
Template has: eslint, prettier, husky, turbo, vitest, typescript pre-configured

title: Implement @agentskills/mcp-server - MCPServer core
description: MCP server initialization using @modelcontextprotocol/sdk. Stdio transport setup. Server lifecycle (init, connect, shutdown). Use SkillRegistry from core. Export createMCPServer() factory.

title: Implement @agentskills/mcp-server - ToolHandler (invoke_skill)
description: Implement invoke_skill tool: enum parameter with all skill names, arguments array. Query SkillRegistry, apply StringInterpolator, return processed skill content. Handle missing skills gracefully.

title: Implement @agentskills/mcp-server - ResourceHandler
description: Expose skill files as MCP resources: skill://<name>/scripts/<file>, skill://<name>/references/<file>, skill://<name>/assets/<file>. Return file content. Path validation to prevent traversal.

title: Implement @agentskills/cli - CLI framework (Commander)
description: Setup Commander.js CLI: main command, subcommands, help text. Entry point (index.ts), bin setup in package.json. Global error handling, colored output (Chalk).

title: Implement CLI command: create
description: agentskills create <name> - Generate SKILL.md scaffold with frontmatter template, create directory structure (scripts/, references/, assets/). Validate name format before creation.

title: Implement CLI command: validate
description: agentskills validate [path] - Use SkillValidator to check format. Colored output for errors/warnings. Exit code 0 (success) or 1 (failure). Support --all flag.

title: Implement CLI command: list
description: agentskills list - Use SkillDiscovery to find all skills. Display name, description, location. Support --json flag for scripting. Use Ora spinner for discovery.

title: Implement CLI command: config
description: agentskills config init/list/set - Initialize .agentskills/config.yaml, show current config, set values. Use ConfigManager from core.

title: Write integration tests for CLI
description: Test each CLI command with temp file systems. Test create (output files), validate (exit codes), list (output format), config (file creation). Use snapshot testing for output.

title: Create example skills for testing
description: Create 3-5 example skills demonstrating features: basic skill, skill with scripts, skill with arguments, skill with references. Use for testing and documentation.

title: Implement @agentskills/core - SkillParser
description: Parse SKILL.md files: YAML frontmatter (js-yaml) + Markdown body. Handle required fields (name, description), optional fields, Claude Code extensions. Return immutable Skill object.

title: Setup linting and formatting (ESLint + Prettier)
description: Configure ESLint (TypeScript rules), Prettier, lint-staged, husky pre-commit hooks. Add lint/format scripts to all packages. Follow agentic-knowledge patterns.

title: Write README and documentation
description: Root README: overview, installation, quick start. Per-package READMEs. CLI usage guide. MCP server setup guide (Claude Desktop config). Architecture/design docs already complete.

title: Add CLI init command for downloading configured skills
description: Add agentskills init command to download git-based skills declared in config. Similar to agentic-knowledge init. Clones git repos, creates symlinks, tracks in metadata. MVP can just validate that all local_directory sources exist.

title: Update design.md to clarify: defaults only apply when no config file exists
Add getConfigSource() to ConfigManager for logging where config came from
Implement 'agentskills init' command to generate starter config
Delete old ConfigManager implementation and tests
description: Remove path-based config system: config-manager.ts, config-manager.test.ts, and related test files. Mark agent-skills-1.4.6 as obsolete.

title: Add pacote dependency to core package
description: pnpm add pacote to @agentskills/core. Also add @types/pacote for TypeScript support.

title: Implement SkillInstaller using Pacote
description: Create skill-installer.ts that uses Pacote to download skills from git/local/tarball sources. Include install(), getManifest(), and lock file generation.

title: Implement new PackageConfigManager
description: Read package.json, parse agentskills and agentskillsConfig fields. Support defaults when no package.json found.

title: Implement @agentskills/core - SkillValidator
description: Validate Agent Skills format: frontmatter structure, required/optional fields, name format (1-64 chars, lowercase-hyphens), description length (1-1024 chars). Return ValidationResult with errors array.

title: Update SkillRegistry to load from installed + auto-discover
description: Modify registry to load from .agentskills/skills/ first, then auto-discover paths. Installed skills take precedence.

title: Implement 'agentskills install' command
description: CLI command that reads package.json agentskills field and installs all declared skills using SkillInstaller.

title: Implement 'agentskills add' command
description: CLI command to add skill to package.json and install it. Usage: agentskills add github:user/repo

title: Rename packages to @codemcp/agentskills-* scope, setup CI/CD, create GitHub repo, and publish v0.0.1
Implement @agentskills/core - StringInterpolator
description: Replace placeholders in skill content: $ARGUMENTS (full array), $N (specific arg), ${CLAUDE_SESSION_ID}. Handle edge cases (missing args, escaping, undefined values).

title: Implement @agentskills/core - SkillRegistry
description: In-memory skill storage with Map-based O(1) lookups. Methods: loadSkills(), getSkill(name), getAllSkills(), getSkillMetadata(), getAllMetadata(). Load on init, no hot reload in MVP. Immutable skills after load.

title: Implement @agentskills/core - ConfigManager
description: Load/parse .agentskills/config.yaml (or .json). Support local_directory sources, defaults (.claude/skills/, ~/.claude/skills/). Return Config object. Handle missing config (use defaults).

title: Implement @agentskills/core - SkillDiscovery
description: Find SKILL.md files in directories (recursive). Handle nested directories, symlinks. Return SkillLocation array with paths. Use glob pattern matching for efficiency.

title: Setup testing infrastructure (Vitest)
description: Configure Vitest: base config + e2e config (single-threaded). Create test/utils/setup.ts with helpers: createTestProject(), createMCPClient(). Setup coverage (v8). Follow agentic-knowledge patterns.

title: Write unit tests for @agentskills/core
description: Test SkillParser, SkillValidator, StringInterpolator, SkillRegistry, ConfigManager. Aim for 80%+ coverage. Use temp file systems for isolation. Test edge cases and error paths.

title: Finalize
description: You are in the finalize phase. This phase ensures code quality and documentation accuracy through systematic cleanup and review. **STEP 1: Code Cleanup** Systematically clean up development artifacts: 1. **Remove Debug Output**: Search for and remove all temporary debug output statements used during development.    Look for language-specific debug output methods (console logging, print statements, debug output functions).    Remove any debugging statements that were added for development purposes.  2. **Review TODO/FIXME Comments**:    - Address each TODO/FIXME comment by either implementing the solution or documenting why it's deferred    - Remove completed TODOs    - Convert remaining TODOs to proper issue tracking if needed  3. **Remove Debugging Code Blocks**:    - Remove temporary debugging code, test code blocks, and commented-out code    - Clean up any experimental code that's no longer needed    - Ensure proper error handling replaces temporary debug logging  **STEP 2: Documentation Review** Review and update documentation to reflect final implementation: 1. **Update Long-Term Memory Documents**: Based on what was actually implemented:    • Update  if requirements changed during development    • Update  if architectural decisions evolved    • Update  if design details were refined or changed 2. **Compare Against Implementation**: Review documentation against actual implemented functionality 3. **Update Changed Sections**: Only modify documentation sections that have functional changes 4. **Remove Development Progress**: Remove references to development iterations, progress notes, and temporary decisions 5. **Focus on Final State**: Ensure documentation describes the final implemented state, not the development process 6. **Ask User to Review Document Updates** 6. **Comprehensive Documentation**: Ensure project has complete documentation for newcomers including setup, usage, architecture overview, and contribution guidelines **STEP 3: Final Validation** - Run existing tests to ensure cleanup didn't break functionality - Verify documentation accuracy with a final review - Ensure project is ready for users and contributors   Update task progress and mark completed work as you finalize the project.

title: agent-skills: epcc (development-plan-include-mcp.md)
description: Responsible vibe engineering session using epcc workflow for agent-skills

title: Explore
description: You are in the exploration phase. Research the codebase, understand existing patterns, and gather context about the problem space. If you are not certain about conventions or rules, ask the user about them. Read relevant files and documentation. If  exists, understand and document requirements there, otherwise document them in your task management system. Don't write code yet - focus on understanding. Document your findings and create tasks as needed.

title: Understand current SKILL.md frontmatter schema and parsing
description: Review types.ts and parser.ts to understand current frontmatter fields and how they are parsed

title: Research MCP server naming conventions
description: Research standard MCP server package naming and identifier formats to design dependency format

title: Review use cases and design dependency format
description: Analyze GitHub issue use cases and design the YAML schema for declaring MCP dependencies

title: Identify files requiring changes
description: List all source files that need modification for this feature

title: Plan
description: You are in the planning phase. Create a detailed implementation strategy based on your exploration. If  exists, base your strategy on requirements from , otherwise use existing task context. Break down the work into specific, actionable tasks. Consider edge cases, dependencies, and potential challenges. If it impacts the general architecture and  exists, document this in , otherwise create tasks to track architectural decisions. If  exists, make sure to adhere to the design in . Document the planning work thoroughly and create implementation tasks as needed.

title: Analyze solution approaches for MCP server specification
description: Evaluate different approaches for how skills can declare MCP server dependencies with full specifications

title: Research MCP server configuration standards
description: Investigate how MCP clients configure servers, what format they expect, and if there are standards

title: Design schema for MCP server dependencies
description: Design the YAML schema for declaring MCP server dependencies in SKILL.md based on chosen approach

title: Define how agents consume MCP dependency information
description: Specify how this information flows from SKILL.md to agent and what actions agent should take

title: Design SKILL.md schema for MCP dependencies
description: Define YAML schema for requires-mcp-servers field with server specs

title: Design MCP Config Manager component
description: Design module to read/write MCP client configs (Claude Desktop, Cline, etc.)

title: Design CLI dependency validation flow
description: Design how agentskills install checks for missing MCP servers and handles --with-mcp flag

title: Define TypeScript types for MCP dependencies
description: Define interfaces for MCP server specs, config manager, and validation results

title: Evaluate JSON Schema approach for validation
description: Research if we should use JSON Schema instead of manual validation as frontmatter complexity increases

title: Code
description: Follow your plan and if  exists, follow the design from  to build the solution. If  exists, build according to the architecture in . If  exists, ensure requirements from  are met, otherwise ensure existing requirements are met based on your task context. Write clean, well-structured code with proper error handling. Prevent regression by building, linting and executing existing tests. Stay flexible and adapt the plan as you learn more during implementation. Update task progress and create new tasks as needed for implementation work.

title: Add Ajv dependency and setup JSON Schema validation
description: Add Ajv to package.json, create schema file structure, set up validation framework
notes: Completed by choosing manual validation approach. JSON Schema not needed - manual validator handles complex rules better and is already complete with 277 passing tests.

title: Implement CLI --with-mcp flag and parameter prompting
description: Add --with-mcp flag, implement user prompting for parameters, update MCP config

title: Write tests for JSON Schema validation
description: Test schema validation for all fields, edge cases, error messages

title: Write tests for MCP Config Manager
description: Test read/write/detect for all supported MCP clients

title: Write tests for dependency checking and CLI flow
description: Test install command with/without --with-mcp flag, error messages, parameter prompting

title: Update example skill with requires-mcp-servers
description: Add example MCP dependencies to demo/local-skills/example-skill/SKILL.md

title: Update README documentation
description: Document requires-mcp-servers field, --with-mcp flag, and supported MCP clients

title: Define JSON Schema for SKILL.md frontmatter
description: Create skill-schema.json with validation rules for all fields including requires-mcp-servers
notes: Completed by choosing manual validation approach. JSON Schema not needed - manual validator handles complex rules better and is already complete with 277 passing tests.

title: Refactor validator.ts to use Ajv
description: Replace manual validation logic with Ajv-based validation, maintain backward compatible error codes
notes: Completed by choosing manual validation approach. JSON Schema not needed - manual validator handles complex rules better and is already complete with 277 passing tests.

title: Update types.ts with MCP dependency types
description: Add McpServerDependency, McpParameterSpec, and update SkillMetadata interface

title: Update parser.ts field mapping for requires-mcp-servers
description: Add requires-mcp-servers to requiresMcpServers field mapping

title: Implement MCP Config Manager component
description: Create mcp-config-manager.ts with read/write/detect methods for MCP client configs

title: Implement MCP Dependency Checker
description: Create mcp-dependency-checker.ts to collect and validate MCP dependencies from skills

title: Implement parameter substitution logic
description: Create utility to substitute {{VARIABLES}} in command/args/env with user-provided values

title: Update CLI install command with dependency validation
description: Add MCP dependency checking to install.ts, fail with helpful error if dependencies missing

title: agent-skills: bugfix (development-plan-fix-installation-methods.md)
description: Responsible vibe engineering session using bugfix workflow for agent-skills

title: Reproduce
description: You are in the bug reproduction phase. Work to reliably reproduce the reported bug by gathering specific information:   • What are the exact OS, browser/runtime versions, and hardware specs?   • What is the precise sequence of actions that trigger the bug?   • What error messages, logs, or stack traces are available?   • Does this happen every time or intermittently?   • How many users are affected and what is the business impact?  Create test cases that demonstrate the problem. Document your findings and create tasks as needed.

title: Reproduce the bug: verify pacote.extract is not available with current import style
Document the import structure of pacote v21.3.1
Analyze
description: You are in the bug analysis phase. Examine the code paths involved in the bug, identify the root cause, and understand why the issue occurs. Use debugging tools, add logging, and trace through the problematic code. Document your analysis and create tasks as needed.

title: Identify all files using pacote import
Fix
description: Implement the solution based on your analysis. If  exists, follow the design from . Before implementing, assess the approach:   • How critical is this system? What is the blast radius if the fix causes issues?   • Should this be a minimal fix or a more comprehensive solution? Make targeted changes that address the root cause without introducing new issues. Be careful to maintain existing functionality while fixing the bug.

title: Verify
description: You are in the bug verification phase. Test the fix thoroughly to ensure the original bug is resolved and no new issues were introduced. Run existing tests, create new ones if needed, and verify the solution is robust.

title: Run TypeScript build to check for type errors
Finalize

Look for language-specific debug output methods (console logging, print statements, debug output functions). description: The README shows correct format is 'github:user/repo' not 'github://user/repo.git'

description: Currently 'add --help' fails with missing argument error. Need to configure Commander.js to show help first

title: Improve error messages for invalid spec formats
description: When users provide wrong spec format like 'github://', provide helpful error message showing correct format
